cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 mi SSW of Morgan City, Louisiana and 225 mi SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest to north-northwest toward the southwest Louisiana / upper Texas coast, then turning north inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southwest Louisiana coast between Cameron and Port Arthur

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Alabama-Florida border, including Metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from the central Texas coast to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–50+ mph) possible Wednesday night into Thursday with gusts higher in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation 1–3 ft above ground level possible along the southwest Louisiana coast, locally up to 4 ft near inlets and bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches, isolated amounts near 6 inches could cause flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; short-period visibility restrictions and lightning affecting port operations
